docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 14-- The assassination of prominent Latin American political exiles and the kidnapping or disappearance of many refugees have dramatized the insecurity of the 15,000 people who have fled here in recent years to seek asylum from...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 14-- The assassination of prominent Latin American political exiles and the kidnapping or disappearance of many refugees have dramatized the insecurity of the 15,000 people who have fled here in recent years to seek asylum from military regimes in Chile, Uruguay, Bolivia and Paraguay.
docs.abstract: Article on pol exiles living in Argentina; notes insecurity of 15,000 refugees who fled to Argentina to seek asylum from mil regimes in Chile, Uruguay, Bolivia and Paraguay; notes Argentine Foreign Min Rear Adm Cesar A Guzzetti statement that revolutionary war is concentrated in Argentina because subversives were forced out of neighboring countries; unemployment and arrest of Chilean exile Nelson Catalan Areanas discussed; apparent kidnapping of Margarita Michelini noted (M)

headline.main: Political Exiles Are Living in Fear in Argentina; Appeal to Governments. Unemployment and Arrest

byline.original: By JUAN de ONIS Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: CARACAS, Venezuela--After decades as a silent walk-on In the theater of international affairs, Venezuela in the last two years has transformed itself onto a leading actor. Venezuela's new stature in international organizations such as the...
docs.lead_paragraph: CARACAS, Venezuela--After decades as a silent walk-on In the theater of international affairs, Venezuela in the last two years has transformed itself onto a leading actor. Venezuela's new stature in international organizations such as the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries and the International Monetary Fund has partially overshadowed the traditional prominence of Mexico, Argentina and Brazil in Latin American affairs.

headline.main: It Is Using Its Oil Wealth to Back Its Policies; Venezuela, Strong Voice of the World's Poor

docs.snippet: Robert V. Carey, who retired last December after 30 years as an administrative and fiscal officer in the State Department's Foreign Service, died last Thursday of cancer at his home in Lake City, Colo. He was 55 years old.

docs.snippet: An official of the United States Department of State said yesterday that the presence of a Rhodesian national team in the Federation Cup tennis tournament in Philadelphia "has embarrassed us very, very much." The official also said the team members...
docs.lead_paragraph: An official of the United States Department of State said yesterday that the presence of a Rhodesian national team in the Federation Cup tennis tournament in Philadelphia "has embarrassed us very, very much." The official also said the team members one male manager and four female players-might face deportation if it is determined that they entered the country illegally.
docs.abstract: State Dept official says Rhodesian players may be deported if they entered US illegally; US has no diplomatic relations with Rhodesia and Rhodesian passports are not considered valid for obtaining travel visas in US; Rhodesians entered US on valid passports from Netherlands and S Africa that either were obtained through relatives or, in case of Eddie Brans, because of birth in Netherlands (M)

headline.main: Rhodesia Team Faces Inquiry On Passports; Rhodesians Face Inquiry on Passports

headline.main: MARKET PLUNGES IN SLOW TRADING; DOW IS OFF 10.39; Analysts Cite Concern Over Slowdown in Economy and Steel and Car Price Rises DROP IS WEEK'S BIGGEST Continued Drift Is Forecast Until Presidential Nominees Clarify Their Policies Market Plummets 10.39, Largely in Late Trading

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Aug. 27-- Earlier this month 37 Roman Catholic clergymen, including 13 bishops and archbishops, were arrested by the Ecuadorean military Government as they met in Riobamba, a small city 100 miles south of Quito, Ecuador's capital.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Aug. 27-- Earlier this month 37 Roman Catholic clergymen, including 13 bishops and archbishops, were arrested by the Ecuadorean military Government as they met in Riobamba, a small city 100 miles south of Quito, Ecuador's capital.
docs.abstract: Deterioration in ch-state relations in Latin Amer in past decade has been underlined by recent expulsion from Ecuador of RC clergymen meeting there to discuss pol and soc ills of Latin Amer; situation in Ecuador, Chile, Uruguay, Paraguay and Brazil discussed; illus of Raul Cardinal Silva Henriquez visiting Chilean Pres Augusto Pinochet (L)

keywords.value: AMERICAN NATIONS AND WESTERN HEMISPHERE POSSESSIONS

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 1 Uruguay's military regime today installed as President a conservative lawyer, Aparicio Mendez, who immediately canceled the political rights of the leaders of all existing parties.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Sept. 1 Uruguay's military regime today installed as President a conservative lawyer, Aparicio Mendez, who immediately canceled the political rights of the leaders of all existing parties.
docs.abstract: Aparicio Mendez is installed, Sept 1, as Uruguay's Pres and immediately cancels pol rights of leaders of all existing parties, including former Pres Juan Maria Bordaberry, W Ferreira Aldunate, Gen Liber Seregni, Jorge Pacheco Areco and Jorge Batlle (M)

headline.main: Uruguay's New President Ends Rights of Thousands
